description: From Old French rasseürer (French rassurer), from re- + asseürer; as if re- +‎ assure.

verbs.description: reassure (third-person singular simple present reassures, present participle reassuring, simple past and past participle reassured)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To assure anew; to restore confidence to; to free from fear or self-doubt.
examples: The boy's mother reassured him that there was no monster hiding under the bed.
